Key Match Events: Javier Sanoja recorded an RBI in his Major League debut on Saturday, then followed that up with two hits in his first start on Sunday.
Sanoja sent veteran right-hander Taijuan Walker's first-pitch sweeper to short, where Trea Turner's throw home got away from catcher Garrett Stubbs and scored two runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Skip Schumaker emphasized the importance of Sanoja's ability to put the ball in play to all fields with a simple right-handed stroke.
Post-Match Reflections: Sanoja's teammates celebrated his performance after the final out.
Sanoja felt the rush of emotions before running out to center field for Sunday's start, but got over it quickly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Javier Sanoja is the youngest Marlins position player to debut since teammate Jose Devers (21 years, 138 days) on April 24, 2021.
Sanoja's progress inspired by countryman Jose Altuve's advice.
Sanoja received a promotion to Triple-A Jacksonville after a 15-game stretch at Double-A Pensacola to start the season.
